alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 3:37PM EST until December 29 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Raritan River At Bound Brook affecting Somerset and Middlesex Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Raritan River At Manville affecting Somerset and Middlesex Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in New Jersey... North Branch Raritan River At Raritan affecting Somerset County. For the Raritan River...including Stanton, Raritan, Manville, Bound Brook...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Raritan River at Bound Brook. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Backyard and low areas are protected by levees and the flood wall. Without the levees or if there is a breach in the levees, minor flooding will occur. At 30.0 feet, Main Street is protected by flap valves/sluice gates. This level triggers the gate closures to protect Main Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 28.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 PM EST Thursday was 28.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.5 feet on 03/11/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Raritan River Bound Brook 28.0 28.9 Thu 3 pm 24.8 21.3 29.5 7pm 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM EST.
